msIdentifier.institution: Royal Asiatic Society of Great Britain and Ireland

author.persName: Khāqānī, Afz̤al al-Dīn Shirvānī, ca. 1126-1198 or 9

msItem.title: Kullīyāt-i Khāqānī
كليات خاقانی
msItem.note: (The prose preface to the Tuhfat al-'Iraqain, the verse of which appears to be lacking.) F1a: a) Signature of David Price 1794. b) Note of acquisition from Hajji Kazim. c) Obscure note dated 2 Dhu 'l-Qa'dah regnal year 3. Comprises the qasidahs, tbe muqatta'at, and the diwan. A manuscript of high quality. Ruled margins and dividing panels in gold and colours, the panels filled with floral scrolls on a gold background. Headings in white outlined with black. Twelve pages of particularly rich illumination, at the beginning and the openings of sections of the work. The first two, preceding the illumination title opening have lively scenes of princely hunting and hawking, presumably Safavid and from the earlier part of the sixteenth century. Nearly all the figures wear the taj with the tall baton. These miniatures are not in Robinson's catalogue.
msItem.incipit: Incipit, illuminated page: Khair ma i'tasama al-mar' bih[ib]alihi

condition.p: Some damage from damp. The inner margins have been replaced.

layoutDesc.p: 17 lines to the page, mostly in two columns

bindingDesc.p: Blue leather binding with tooled title etc, Carnegie U.K. Trust grant 1929.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
